laboratory_examinations.findings: FECES NEGATIVE FOR C. DIFFICILE TOXIN BY EIA. (Reference Range-Negative).

Apparent cardiac enlargement is explained by lordotic positioning. There is no evidence of acute pulmonary edema or focal consolidation. Left-sided peripheral line remains unchanged as well as bi-lead pacemaker. There is mild bibasilar atelectasis and right lung scarring. Stable elevation of the left hemidiaphragm is secondary to volume loss from prior resection.
